column23: Principle 1:  Relevance, impartiality and equal accessDoes your statistical legislation require official statistics to be compiled and published on an independent and impartial basis?
column24: Principle 2:  Professional standards and ethicsDoes your statistical legislation require reliable methods and procedures that are in accordance with scientific and professional standards by which official statistics are to be collected, processed, and stored?
column25: Principle 3: Accountability and transparencyDoes the statistical legislation contain provision(s) on how public statistics and methods are to be presented?
column26: Principle 4: Prevention of misuseDoes your statistical legislation entitle statistical agencies to flag misuse of statistics?
column27: Principle 5: Sources of official statisticsDoes your statistical legislation contain clear mandate for statistical agencies to collect data all kinds of sources according to established quality criteria?
column28: Principle 6: Confidentiality Does your statistical legislation impose that collected data is strictly confidential and will be used exclusively for statistical purposes?
column29: Principle 7: Legislation Is your statistical legislation publicly available?
column30: Principle 8: National Coordination Does your statistical legislation require coordination among statistical agencies within your country?
column31: Principle 9: Use of international standards Does your statistical legislation require the alignment of methods and classifications with international standards?
column32: Principle 10: International cooperationDoes your statistical legislation require/encourage the engagements in bilateral and multilateral cooperation in statistics?

column22: Statistics Portugal activity is established by the Annual Work Programmes of Statistics Portugal and ONA (Other National Authorities) and follows the strategic guidance of the General Guidelines of Official Statistical Activity that cover a multiannual period (e.g. 2023-2027; 2018-2022) and are a strategic reference instrument of the National Statistical System, relevant to guide its activities, in the period under review, and also the European statistics programme.
column37: Official statistical activity in Portugal follows the relevant national and European legislation, most notably, the Law of the National Statistical System (Law no. 22/2022), Statistics Portugal's Organic Law (Decree-Law no. 136/2012) and Regulation (EC) no. 223/2009 on European Statistics, further developed in the European Statistics Code of Practice. For more information, please consult: https://www.ine.pt/xportal/xmain?xpid=INE&xpgid=ine_inst_legislacao&xlang=en

Albania’s law on official statistics is in line with the European Statistics Code of Practice and also aligned with Regulation (EC) No.223/2009 of the European Parliament and Council, dated 11.03.2009 on European statistics,

Singapore’s Statistics Act (link: https://www.singstat.gov.sg/who-we-are/statistics-act) allows the Singapore Department of Statistics (DOS) and the Research and Statistics Units (RSUs) gazetted under the Act to collect data for statistical purposes. The Public Sector (Governance) Act (PSGA) (link: https://sso.agc.gov.sg/Act/PSGA2018) and the administration acts of agencies (e.g., Income Tax Act, Telecommunications Act) also facilitate the collection of relevant data by public agencies.

column22: Statistics Law of Türkiye, which laid the foundation of the Turkish Statistical System, authorizes TurkStat (Turkish Statistical Institute) to determine the statistical methods, definitions, classifications and standards to be used in the production of official statistics in line with national and international norms ;	to compile, evaluate, analyze and publish statistics in the required areas  and to prepare Official Statistics Programme and monitor it. The Official Statistical Programme (OSP) establishes a framework for official statistics, defines all authorities responsible for producing official statistics and their duties and defines the methodology, period, date of dissemination of all official statistics produced in Türkiye. OSP is prepared for a 5 year period and the last once covers 2022-2026. In addition to this,  there is Strategic Plan of TurkStat which specifies the compilation duty of TurkStat for overall statistics and states its mission and vision.

column37: The United Nations resolution 68/261 – Fundamental Principles of Official Statistics, informed development of the policy that underpins New Zealand’s Data and Statistics Act 2022. We consider that all Principles are reflected in the Act but in some cases this is not explicit. Please see below commentary for Principles where consideration is implicit.   Re: Principle 2, there are several provisions that implicitly refer to reliable methods and procedures for official statistics: a purpose of the Act is to ensure production of high-quality official statistics (section 3(a)); a function of the Government Statistician is to guide and direct best practice in producing and communicating official statistics (section 13(f)); and the Government Statistician can set mandatory standards for collecting data, producing statistics and undertaking research (section 90).   Re: Principle 9, although section 13 ‘Functions of Statistician’ does not require the alignment of methods and classifications with international standards, it does include the function ‘to collaborate with statistics offices or agencies outside New Zealand to produce globally comparable statistics’. Stats NZ considers that this work would not be possible without the alignment of methods and classifications with international standards.

column22: Every year the programme of statistical work containing the list of official statistical information produced by state statistics bodies and state organisations authorized to produce state statistics is approved and financed from the funds allocated for the activities of state statistics bodies in accordance with the Law of the Republic of Belarus on Republican Budget for respective year.  The Strategy for the Development of State Statistics until 2025 is currently being implemented.
column37: The amendments to the Law of the Republic of Belarus “On State Statistics” have been adopted, addressing, among others, the principles of state statistics. There has been substantial transformation of the principle of confidentiality of primary statistical data and proportionality of the burden on respondents to the needs of users, the essence and contents of each principle have been updated taking into account international and foreign statistical practice.

The State Statistics Service of Ukraine carries out its activity in line with Ukraine's law on official statistics, №2524-XI (took effect on January 1, 2023), of August 16, 2022. Artical 9 "Statistical methodology" of the law . Item1. Statistical methodology based on the results of scientific research, international recommendations and the world's experience, best examples of statistical practices taking into account the national and historic environment of Ukraine.  Article 40 "International cooperation in the sphere of official statistics" of the law. Item 2. For the purpose of harmonizing legislation in the sphere of official statistics, the central executive authority on statistics, within bilateral and multilateral cooperation with statistical bureaus of foreign countries and international organizations, organizes and undertakes actions in the sphere of statistics that are of common interests.

column22: Link to the Polish Statistical Plan: https://bip.stat.gov.pl/dzialalnosc-statystyki-publicznej/program-badan-statystycznych/ (in Polish only). Statistics Poland considers the Statistical surveys programme of official statistics (PBSSP) as a the ‘national statistical plan’ / ‘statistical planning document’ mentioned in the questionnaire and our answers refer to the PBSSP. However, please note that the recent 3rd round of peer review in the European Statistical System on the degree of implementation of European Statistics Code of Practice in Poland resulted in a recommendation on: “Statistics Poland should establish a multi-annual strategic work plan to encompass directions, objectives and priorities in the longer term, as a framework for the implementation of the annual Statistical surveys programme of official statistics”. This recommendation would result in improvement action(s) elaborated by Statistics Poland. The work on them is currently in progress.
column37: Link to the Polish Statistical Law: Act of 29 June 1995 on Official Statistics - Bulletin of Public Information / Law / Act on Official Statistics (https://bip.stat.gov.pl/en/law/law-on-public-statistics/). In the 3rd round of European Statistical System peer review of the degree of implementation of European Statistics Code of Practice, Statistics Poland was found highly compliant with the ES CoP thus we consider being in compliance also with the 10 Principles of the FPOS as the ES CoP was elaborated based on and is in line with UN quality standard. The detailed report from our peer review exercise can be found at: Bulletin of Public Information / Activity of Official Statistics / Quality in statistics / Peer review / III round of Peer Review (https://bip.stat.gov.pl/en/activity-of-public-statistics/quality-in-statistics/peer-review/iii-peer-review/ ). Please also note that Statistics Poland recognizes the Act of 29 June 1995 on Official Statistics as Polish Commitment on Confidence in Statistics (required by EU legislation). More information can be found on Bulletin of Public Information / Law / Commitment on Confidence in Statistics (https://bip.stat.gov.pl/en/law/commitment-on-confidence-in-statistics/ ) where extract from the provisions of the Act of 29 June 1995 on Official Statistics implementing the specific principles of the European Statistics Code of Practice (ES CoP) are enumerated.
